snippet: Details buried in a United Nations report indicate the Syrian military launched the chemical attack from the same ridges it used for firing conventional munitions.
abstract: Details buried in United Nations report on Syrian chemical weapons attack point directly at elite military formations loyal to President Bashar al-Assad; report reveals some of strongest findings to date suggesting government gassed its own people.

byline.contributor: Anne Barnard and Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon; Eric Schmitt from Washington; and Karam Shoumali from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: Details buried in a United Nations report indicate the Syrian military launched the chemical attack from the same ridges it used for firing conventional munitions.

headline.main: U.N. Data on Gas Attack Point to Assad’s Top Forces
headline.print_headline: Data in Gas Attack Points to Assad’s Top Forces

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
